text: • A common ground for software engineering
• Moving away from SE methods “fashion” industry.
• OMG Standard under the name Essence
• The SEMAT Kernel – manifestation of the common ground
• comprises the central elements for all SE methods;
• provides a common language for comparing, applying, and improving methods;
• works in small- and large-scale projects;
• works for well documented and less documented projects;
• comes with a language and tool for developing practices.
• Uptake in China, Russia, South Africa, Japan, Silicon Valley, Florida, Mexico, Germany
• It is highly probable that this will be used much more in the future.
• By focusing on the Essentials, the project groups have more freedom and responsibility.
Use and exploitation of the system
The team and approach of work
• Alpha is an acronym for an Abstract-Level Progress Health Attribute.
• A critical indicator of things that are most important to monitor and progress.

What the software system must do to address the opportunity and satisfy the stakeholders.
Conceived \ ‘o Bounded Coherent Acceptable Addressed @ Fullfilled |
The need for a new system has been agreed.
The purpose and theme of the new system are cileatr.
The requirements provide a coherent description of the essential characteristics of the new system.
The requirements describe a system that is acceptable to the stakeholders.
Enough of the requirements have been addressed to satisfy the need for a new system in a way that is acceptable to the stakeholders.
The requirements have been addressed to fully satisfy the need for a new system.
The initial set of stakeholders agrees that a system is to be produced.
The stakeholders that will use the new system are identified.
The stakeholders that will fund the initial work on the new system are identified.
There is a clear opportunity for the new system to address.
Applying Essence in Practice / Essence Workshop / 20 June 2013

o The stakeholders involved in developing the new system are identified. The stakeholders agree on the purpose of the new system. Bounded It is clear what success is for the new system. The stakeholders have a shared understanding of the extent of the proposed solution. The way the requirements will be described is agreed upon. The mechanisms for managing the requirements are in place. The prioritization scheme is clear. Constraints are identified and ¢ ered E Assumptions are clearl ated.

An architecture has been selectedthat addresses the key technical risks and any applicable organizational constraints. An executable version of the system is available that Demonstrable demonstratesthe architecture is fit for purpose and supports functional and non-functional testing. Usahle he system is usable and demonstrates all of the quality characteristics required of an operational system. he system (as a whole)has been accepted for Ready deploymentin alive environment. Operational The system isin usein a live environment. Retired The system is nolonger supported. 0000 0

The stakeholders have been identified. The mechanisms forinvolving the stakeholders are agreed andthe stakeholder representatives have been appointed. The stakeholder representatives are actively involvedin the work and fulfilling their responsibilities. In The stakeholder representatives are in agreement. Agreement Stakeholders Satisfied for The minimal expectations of the stakeh older representatives have been Deployment achieved. Satisfied in The system meets or exceeds the minimal stakeh older expectations. Use

Acommercial, social or business opportunity has been identified that could be addressed by a software-based solution. Solution The needfor a software-based solution has been Needed confirmed. Value Thevalue of a successful solution has been established. Established Itis agreed that a solution can be produced quickly and cheaply enough to successfully addressthe opportunity. Opportunity Asolution has been produ ced that demon strably addresses the opportunity. Benefit The operational use or sale of the solution is creating Accrued tangible benefits.

Theteam’s mission s clearandthe know-how needed to growthe teamis in place. Theteamhas been populatedwith enough committed people to start the mission The team members are workingtogetheras one unit. TEAM Theteamis working effectively and efficiently. Theteamis no longer accountable for carrying outits mission.

Work has been requested. All pre-conditions for starting the work h ave been met. Thework is proceeding. Thework is goingwell, risks are under control and produ ctivity Work levels are sufficientto achieve a satisfactory result. Thework to producethe results has been concluded. All remaining housekeeping tasks have been completed andthework has been officially closed.

The principles, and constraints, that shape the way-of-working Principles are established. Established Foundation The key practices, andtools, that form the foundation of the Established way of working are selected and ready for use. In Use Some members of the team are using, and adapting, the way-of-working. i All team members are usingthe way-of-workingto accomplish theirtasks. The way-of-workingis workingwell forthe team. Way-of-Working Theway-of-workingisnolongerin use by the team.

* Development The ability to design and program effective software systems following the standards and norms agreed by the team. womes ® e * e X Applies * w4 %
Assists Demonstrates a basic understanding of the con- cepts and can follow instructions.

Applies Able to apply the concepts in simple contexts by routinely applying the experience gained so far. Masters Able to apply the concepts in most contexts and has the experience to work without supervision. Adapts Able to apply judgment on when and how to apply the concepts to more complex contexts. Can enable others to apply the concepts.
Innovates A recognized expert, able to extend the concepts to new contexts and inspire others.
